thread.title: Prada's Milan Fashion Week show is for cozy girls everywhere
thread.title_full: Prada's Milan Fashion Week show is for cozy girls everywhere

title: Prada's Milan Fashion Week show is for cozy girls everywhere
text: Prada's Milan Fashion Week show is for cozy girls everywhere Furry boots, grandmother-style crocheted sweaters, and extra-fluffy hoods took over Prada's Milan Fashion Week runway, with a show that turned cozy-girl style into a high-fashion collection. Post to Facebook Prada's Milan Fashion Week show is for cozy girls everywhere Furry boots, grandmother-style crocheted sweaters, and extra-fluffy hoods took over Prada's Milan Fashion Week runway, with a show that turned cozy-girl style into a high-fashion collection.  //usat.ly/2mcCwLy   Join the Nation's Conversation To   Prada's Milan Fashion Week show is for cozy girls everywhere None Furry boots, grandmother-style crocheted sweaters, and extra-fluffy hoods took over Prada's Milan Fashion Week runway, with a show that turned cozy-girl style into a high-fashion collection. GIUSEPPE CACACE, AFP/Getty Images Someone's ready for the tundra. GIUSEPPE CACACE, AFP/Getty Images Many of the models sported oversized hooded hats, sometimes paired with skimpy dresses. GIUSEPPE CACACE, AFP/Getty Images The collection also made the case for pairing spring dresses with fuzzy winter boots. GIUSEPPE CACACE, AFP/Getty Images A closer look at Prada's furry footwear. GIUSEPPE CACACE, AFP/Getty Images Yes, that's a pair of fuzzy slippers on a fashion week runway. Luca Bruno, AP None Granny sweaters also made a major appearance in Prada's show, ripped straight from the closet of 'Twin Peaks' Audrey Horne. GIUSEPPE CACACE, AFP/Getty Images If one sweater isn't enough, this model advocates layering three. GIUSEPPE CACACE, AFP/Getty Images None Can't quite figure out the transition from winter to spring? This Prada look suggests pairing your favorite cardigan with a bandeau top, with nothing in between. Luca Bruno, AP Even the collection's skirts were made of cozy fabric. Luca Bruno, AP While this plushy gown won't flatter many body types, it sure looks comfortable. FLAVIO LO SCALZO, EPA None Prada didn't just parade fur coats and sweaters down the runway, also featuring more structured belted jackets. FLAVIO LO SCALZO, EPA Though even the collection's simpler coats still featured some fur. Luca Bruno, AP Like this topic? You may also like these photo galleries: Replay
